alfredsnippet.snippet:
(cont'd)

"Within each nephelometer was a sensitive radiometer that reacted to ever smaller changes in outside light. Those radiometers showed only gloom around the two probes dropping through darkness -- until the temperature sensors failed.

At almost exactly that instance, the radiometers detected a faint glow in the atmosphere.  The glow grew brighter and brighter as the space probes left the cloud over above them."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Venus' Ashen Light - Part 2
